items.question: SI.L1-B.1.XII – Flaw Remediation
How does your organization identify system flaws and vulnerabilities?
Notes / Evidence
items.value: Weekly scans via Qualys/Nessus, monthly penetration testing, continuous vendor patch notifications.

items.question: Flaw Reporting and Tracking
How are identified flaws reported and tracked?
Notes / Evidence
items.value: Formal tracking system (JIRA/SNOW), automatic management notifications, risk assessment and prioritization, communication to stakeholders, detailed documentation of findings

items.codingInstructions: Establish processes to identify, report, and track system flaws and vulnerabilities until they are resolved.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Establish processes to identify, report, and track system flaws and vulnerabilities until they are resolved.

items.question: Flaw Correction Timeline
What are your target timeframes for correcting identified flaws?

items.codingInstructions: Define and follow timelines to promptly address and fix identified system vulnerabilities to reduce security risks.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Define and follow timelines to promptly address and fix identified system vulnerabilities to reduce security risks.

items.question: Patch Management Process
How are security patches and updates managed?

answers.text: Testing in non-production environment before deployment
Rollback procedures in case of issues
Emergency patching procedures for critical flaws

value.text: Testing in non-production environment before deployment
Rollback procedures in case of issues
Emergency patching procedures for critical flaws

extension.valueString: Any additional context, challenges, or implementation details...
List or describe the supporting documentation you have available (policies, procedures, scan reports, etc.)...

items.question: Supporting Documentation
items.codingInstructions: Note: Have documentation available that demonstrates your flaw remediation processes, vulnerability scanning procedures, and patch management policies.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Note: Have documentation available that demonstrates your flaw remediation processes, vulnerability scanning procedures, and patch management policies.
items.value: Patch management policy v3.4, change management SOP, vulnerability remediation logs

items.codingInstructions: Implement procedures to regularly apply updates and patches to systems to protect against known vulnerabilities.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Implement procedures to regularly apply updates and patches to systems to protect against known vulnerabilities.

items.codingInstructions: Identify, report, and correct information and information system flaws in a timely manner
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Identify, report, and correct information and information system flaws in a timely manner

items.question: SI.L1-B.1.XIII – Malicious Code Protection
Do you have a malicious code protection policy document?
Protection Locations
Select all locations where malicious code protection is implemented:

items.codingInstructions: Identify and secure critical points in systems and networks where integrity controls must be applied to prevent unauthorized changes.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Identify and secure critical points in systems and networks where integrity controls must be applied to prevent unauthorized changes.

items.question: Implementation Details
Primary Anti-Malware Product/Solution: e.g., Microsoft Defender, McAfee, Symantec
Anti-Malware Version/Release: Version number or release identifier
Implementation Scope: Describe the scope of your anti-malware implementation (e.g., all company endpoints, specific servers)
items.value: Organization-wide deployment on endpoints, servers, and remote devices

items.codingInstructions: Deploy and maintain tools and processes to detect, prevent, and respond to malware infections in your systems.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Deploy and maintain tools and processes to detect, prevent, and respond to malware infections in your systems.

extension.valueString: Any additional context, challenges, or implementation details...
List or describe the supporting documentation you have available(policies, configuration guides, deployment records, etc.)...

items.question: Supporting Documentation
items.codingInstructions: Note: Have documentation available that demonstrates your malicious code protection policies, anti-malware configurations, and deployment procedures.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Note: Have documentation available that demonstrates your malicious code protection policies, anti-malware configurations, and deployment procedures.

items.codingInstructions: Provide protection from malicious code at appropriate locations within organizational information systems
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Provide protection from malicious code at appropriate locations within organizational information systems

items.question: SI.L1-B.1.XIV – Update Malicious Code Protection
Update Frequency
How frequently are malicious code protection mechanisms updated?

items.codingInstructions: Regularly update malware protection tools and definitions to ensure defense against the latest threats.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Regularly update malware protection tools and definitions to ensure defense against the latest threats.

items.question: Update Management Process
How are malicious code protection updates managed?

answers.text: Notification of update status and failures

value.text: Notification of update status and failures

items.codingInstructions: Establish procedures to manage and verify timely updates to malicious code protection systems.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Establish procedures to manage and verify timely updates to malicious code protection systems.

extension.valueString: Any additional context challenges, or implementation details...
List o describe the supporting documentation you have available (update procedures, verification logs, rollback plans, etc.)...

items.question: Supporting Documentation
items.codingInstructions: Note: Have documentation available that demonstrates your update management procedures, verification processes, and rollback capabilities.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Note: Have documentation available that demonstrates your update management procedures, verification processes, and rollback capabilities.

items.codingInstructions: Update malicious code protection mechanisms when new releases are available
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Update malicious code protection mechanisms when new releases are available

items.question: SI.L1-B.1.XV – System & File Scanning
Do you have a system scanning policy documentation, file scanning policy, and scanning procedure documentation?
Anti-Malware Implementation
Does your organization have antivirus/anti-malware software installed on all systems?
What antivirus/anti-malware solution is currently deployed? e.g., Microsoft Defender, Norton, McAfee, etc.
items.value: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, CrowdStrike Falcon for high-security servers

items.codingInstructions: Deploy anti-malware solutions to regularly scan systems and files for malicious software and remove threats promptly.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Deploy anti-malware solutions to regularly scan systems and files for malicious software and remove threats promptly.

items.question: Periodic Scanning Implementation
How frequently are full system scans conducted?
What level of thoroughness is used for periodic scans?

answers.text: Standard Scan (system files and common user directories)

items.codingInstructions: Schedule regular scans of systems and files to detect and address malware or security issues consistently.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Schedule regular scans of systems and files to detect and address malware or security issues consistently.

items.question: Real-time Scanning & File Integrity
Are files from external sources scanned in real-time?
Do you employ file integrity monitoring for critical system files?
Notes / Evidence
items.value: Standard Scan (system files and common user directories)

items.codingInstructions: Use real-time scanning to detect threats immediately and monitor file integrity to prevent unauthorized changes.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Use real-time scanning to detect threats immediately and monitor file integrity to prevent unauthorized changes.

items.question: Results Handling & Testing

extension.valueString: Describe your process for reviewing and documenting scan results...

items.question: How are scan results reviewed and documented? Describe your process for reviewing and documenting scan results...
What is your response timeframe when malware or vulnerabilities are detected?

extension.valueString: Describe your process for remediating issues detected during scanning..

items.question: Describe your remediation process for identified issues: Describe your process for remediating issues detected during scanning...

extension.valueString: List or describe the supporting documentation you have available(scanning policies , procedures , scan logs , remediation records, etc.)...

items.question: Supporting Documentation
items.codingInstructions: Note: Have documentation available that demonstrates your scanning policies, procedures, scan results, and remediation processes.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Note: Have documentation available that demonstrates your scanning policies, procedures, scan results, and remediation processes.

items.codingInstructions: Establish procedures to review scan results, respond to detected threats, and test scanning tools for effectiveness.
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Establish procedures to review scan results, respond to detected threats, and test scanning tools for effectiveness.

items.codingInstructions: Perform periodic scans of the information system and real-time scans of files from external sources
items.codingInstructionsPlain: Perform periodic scans of the information system and real-time scans of files from external sources
